alert.note: Alert for Kendall (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 22 at 1:14PM CST until February 26 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by steady rainfall over frozen soil continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Illinois, including the following counties, Cook, DuPage, Grundy, Kendall and Will. * WHEN...Until 215 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas including ditches, farm fields, and the shoulders of roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 112 PM CST, automated gauges indicated that streams are exceeding bankfull across the Advisory area. - Between 1 and 2 inches of rain fell this afternoon. No additional appreciable rainfall is expected today. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chicago, Aurora, Joliet, Naperville, Cicero, Bolingbrook, Orland Park, Tinley Park, Oak Lawn, Berwyn, Oak Park, Downers Grove, Romeoville, Plainfield, Calumet City, Woodridge, Oswego, Chicago Heights, Midway Airport and Chicago Lawn. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
